isis.stitle: ANTILOCK BRAKES/TRACTION CONTROL: BENDIX - TROUBLESHOOTING - 2000, 4000 & 8000 MODELS - TROUBLESHOOTING - GENERAL INFORMATION

svcprocinfo.para: The controller contains self-test and diagnostic circuitry that continuously checks for proper operation of the entire Antilock/Traction Control System, including wiring continuity. The system includes:

item.para: M-21/M-22 modulators and circuits to the controller.
Wheel speed sensor and circuits to the controller.

svcprocinfo.para: All of the ABS controllers are programmed at the factory (Bendix), and only those vehicles configured for traction control at International are programmed for traction control. A vehicle configured for traction control will have the Traction Active light and ON/OFF switch on the instrument panel.

svcsubproc.title: Warning and Indicator Lights
svcsubproc.para: The ABS warning light and the Traction Active light inform the driver of the condition and status of the ABS/traction control system. The ten light emitting diodes (LEDs) on the controller provide the service technician with the condition of specific components in the system. No special tools are needed to interpret the diagnostic LED display.

svcsubproc.title: Electronic Service Tools
svcsubproc.para: The ABS controller is connected to the J1587 Data Link connector.
This permits using the Prolink electronic service tool to read diagnostic information from the vehicle data link connector.

svcsubproc.title: Controller LED Operation
svcsubproc.para: When the controller senses a defective condition in the system:

step1.para: The condition is stored in controller memory (data is not lost with power off).
The ABS/traction control system is either totally or partially disabled depending on the condition.
The ABS warning light on the instrument panel is turned ON and remains on as long as the defect is present.

The appropriate controller LEDs are turned ON. If power is turned OFF and then back ON, the LEDs will still be illuminated until the failure is corrected. When the defect is corrected, the service technician can reset and clear the LEDs by holding a small magnet over the RESET point on the LED display.

svcsubproc.para: If two or more component failures occur, the LEDs will show one failure at a time.When the first failure is corrected and the system is reset, the next problem area will be displayed by the LEDs. The system is not restored until all errors are corrected and the controller is reset.
